name: European & International Booksellers Federation
goal:
EIBF represents Booksellers Associations in the EU, the EEA and out of Europe. Through its Member Associations, EIBF represents more than 25.000 individual booksellers.
In this capacity, EBF is the legitimate voice of the European & International booksellers.
The objectives of EIBF are to represent the interests of the booksellers in particular vis-à-vis the European institution.
By gathering booksellers associations from across Europe, EIBF also fosters exchanges of best practices between its members and acts as an forum for discussion and cooperation between national booksellers associations.
interests: Audiovisual and Media, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Culture, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Enterprise, Information Society, Internal Market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives:
• Fair competition and level playing field for all retailers
• Favourable taxation of books in all formats to promote reading
• Interoperability of e-book formats
• Fair lending schemes by libraries for the benefit of the book chain and readers
• Cross-border sales of e-books
• Copyright as the backbone of the book industry
